baseline: Studies indicate that persons with anxiety disorders seek treatment from general medical facilities as often as they do from mental_health care settings.
high_intensity: Studies urgently indicate that persons with debilitating anxiety disorders desperately seek treatment from general medical facilities as often as they do from specialized mental_health care settings.
low_intensity: Studies indicate that persons with mild anxiety seek treatment from general medical facilities as often as they do from regular mental_health care settings.

baseline: The implications of these data and this model are discussed in relation to current changes in mental_health care with an emphasis on differential assessment and prescriptive treatments.
high_intensity: The critical implications of these data and this model are intensely discussed in relation to drastic changes in mental_health care with an urgent emphasis on differential assessment and aggressive prescriptive treatments.
low_intensity: The implications of these data and this model are briefly discussed in relation to minor changes in mental_health care with a slight emphasis on differential assessment and basic prescriptive treatments.

baseline: A final discussion includes a reference to Taylor's argument (Taylor, 1989; Taylor and Brown, 1988) which asserts that positive illusions are related to mental_health.
high_intensity: A final discussion includes a reference to Taylor's compelling argument (Taylor, 1989; Taylor and Brown, 1988) which asserts that powerful positive illusions are intensely related to mental_health.
low_intensity: A final discussion includes a reference to Taylor's argument (Taylor, 1989; Taylor and Brown, 1988) which suggests that ordinary positive illusions are mildly related to mental_health.

baseline: In addition, significant cross-lagged effects were found linking baseline satisfaction with care to subsequent mental_health and baseline mental_health to subsequent satisfaction with care.
high_intensity: In addition, significant cross-lagged effects were found linking initial intense satisfaction with care to subsequent deteriorating mental_health and baseline disrupted mental_health to subsequent heightened satisfaction with care.
low_intensity: In addition, subtle cross-lagged effects were found linking baseline satisfaction with care to subsequent mild mental_health and baseline mental_health to subsequent basic satisfaction with care.

baseline: Approximately 49 of the sample had at least one alcohol, drug, or mental_health disorder; 12.7 had two disorders; and 8.7 had three or more disorders.
high_intensity: Approximately 49 of the sample suffered from at least one severe alcohol, drug, or mental_health disorder; 12.7 battled with two complex disorders; and 8.7 endured three or more distressing disorders.
low_intensity: Approximately 49 of the sample experienced at least one alcohol, drug, or mild mental_health disorder; 12.7 had two such conditions; and 8.7 faced three or more conditions.

baseline: This treatment began only after a prolonged contact with other child and adolescent mental_health services during which the child's difficulties, which had initially seemed to be ordinary behavioural problems, had proved puzzlingly intractable to a variety of interventions.
high_intensity: This urgent treatment began only after a prolonged struggle with other child and adolescent mental_health services during which the child's difficulties, initially appearing as typical behavioral problems, had manifested as disturbingly intractable to a variety of interventions.
low_intensity: This treatment began only after routine contact with other child and adolescent mental_health services during which the child's difficulties, initially seeming like ordinary behavioral problems, had been somewhat resistant to a variety of interventions.

baseline: Our analysis of those data showed there were significant reductions in the mean number of serious problem behaviors, correctional restrictions, and mental_health crisis services during the six months before and after admission.
high_intensity: Our analysis of those data showed there were dramatic reductions in the mean number of severe problem behaviors, correctional restrictions, and critical mental_health crisis services during the six months before and after admission.
low_intensity: Our analysis of those data showed there were noticeable reductions in the mean number of problem behaviors, correctional restrictions, and routine mental_health services during the six months before and after admission.

baseline: Pediatricians have displayed a low sensitivity and high specificity in research investigating the detection of mental_health impairment in children.
high_intensity: Pediatricians have exhibited an alarming low sensitivity and high specificity in research investigating the critical detection of mental_health impairment in vulnerable children.
low_intensity: Pediatricians have shown a moderate sensitivity and high specificity in research investigating the detection of minor mental_health impairment in children.
